list_definition.definition: a case with flat sides for clothes etc, used by a person when travelling

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He hastily packed his (clothes in his) suitcase.

list_ex_of_english: Gernott stands, crosses to pick up his suitcase.
Frankly, that is a paltry figure if one loses a suitcase full of clothes.
The example they present is of someone recognizing her or his suitcase as it moves on a conveyer belt.
They have purses, bags, and suitcases like travellers or refugees.
I do not recognize suitcases and then detect motion.
The event of approaching a suitcase is very complicated visually.
That day, when he returned from his well-paid, responsible position—a pillar of society, if one likes—his wife had packed her suitcase ready to go.
One can see their anxiety when they desperately look and think they see their suitcase and then realise it is not theirs.
